intro: Pseudophegopteris yunkweiensis, commonly known as the Yunkwei fern, is a rare and unique species of fern belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that are typically bipinnate, with a complex arrangement of pinnae and pinnules. Native to China, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions with rich, moist soil. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, typical of many fern species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pseudophegopteris yunkweiensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
